title: Swansea Canal Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Kevin Flynn / The Swansea Canal at Trebanos, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Swansea Canal at Trebanos. A short aqueduct carries the canal over a sidestream flowing from northwest (left) to southeast (right) into the River Tawe here. The houses in this view front the B4603, Swansea Road.

images.title: Nigel Davies / Swansea Canal overflows into Lower Clydach River, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Swansea Canal overflows into Lower Clydach River. The aqueduct here is also a handy overflow maintaining the level in the canal. The excess falls down into the Lower Clydach River just before it joins the Tawe.

images.title: Nigel Davies / On Swansea Canal aqueduct over the Twrch at Gurnos, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: On Swansea Canal aqueduct over the Twrch at Gurnos. This portion of the disused canal is now dry but the south side towpath is a public footpath and may even be part of the mercurial cycle route 43.

images.title: Kevin Flynn / The Swansea Canal at Pontardawe, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Swansea Canal at Pontardawe

description: Enjoy an easy waterside cycle or walk along the Swansea Canal and River Tawe. The route runs from Clydach to Pontardawe along National Cycle Route 43. The route uses the canal towpath and a riverside trail, passing locks and bridges on the way. Look out for a variety of wildlife including otters, kingfishers, dippers, ducks, moths, butterflies and beetles. To extend the walk head into the lovely Cwm Clydach National Nature Reserve in Clydach. There's some lovely riverside trails through a beautiful gorge here.
display_address: Gwalia Court, Aberclydach, Clydach, Swansea, Cymru / Wales, SA6 5LZ, United Kingdom
